Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, looking at Case A1 and B2, the events are very similar in sequence, which probably indicates consistent processes across different products.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Each case starts with retrieving raw metal sheets, scanning barcodes, placing on tables... So maybe the first few steps relate to preparing materials? Like Material Preparation or Setup.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Then after placement comes aligning with Robot Arm #2 and preheating. That might be part of setting up the material for the next step. Preheating is a common process before forming or welding.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Maybe this grouping includes retrieving, scanning, placing, aligning, and preheating as one high-level activity—Material Preparation.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Next steps are picking up welding tools by Operator B followed by welding corners A and B. So maybe these belong to Assembly phase?

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: But measuring weld integrity could be part of a quality check during assembly or as its own step.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: But depending on timing, maybe the assembly includes using the tool, welding specific parts, then checking.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait, but in both cases, after welding there's measurement and then applying coating, drying it, and visual checks. So perhaps three high-level steps: Material Prep, Assembly, Coating/Finishing, Quality Inspection?

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Alternatively, measuring weld integrity could be part of a quality check during assembly or as its own step. Similarly, the coating application might belong to finishing processes.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Looking at temporal proximity, events for A1 from 08:00:05 to 8:01:00 transition from Material Prep (Operator A and Robot Arm) to Operator B.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then next step is picking up tool and welding—Assembly phase?

Name: Validation - IND
Text: After welding comes the measure weld integrity, which could be Quality Inspection. Or maybe part of Assembly's quality control.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Maybe Material Preparation: First five events. Then Welding Assembly (pick tool, welds A/B). Followed by a Post-Welding Quality Check (Measure integrity). Then apply coating and dry as Finishing steps. Final visual check is another QC.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Alternatively, grouping based on resources: Operator A does material prep steps; Operator B handles Assembly/ Welding; Coating Unit for finishing; then Operator C does final check. Thus grouping based on the responsible resource might lead to 1. Material Preparation (Op A, Robot Arm, Heating Unit #1) 2. Welding Operations (Operator B) 3. Post-Welding Processing: Quality Check and Coating 4. Final Inspection (Operator C).

Name: Validation - PE
Text: But maybe that's too broad. Alternatively, grouping by process purpose.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The key is to identify each major phase in manufacturing: Setup/Preparation, Assembly/Welding, Finishing (coating), Quality Inspections at various stages.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So based on this logic, here's how I might group them.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Group 1: Material Preparation (Retrieve raw metal sheet, Scan barcode, Place on table, Align with Robot Arm, Preheat). Rationale: These steps are all about preparing the material for assembly. Retrieving, scanning (likely to track materials), placing in position, alignment ensures proper setup, and preheating readies the metal for welding.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Group 2: Welding Assembly (Pick up welding tool, Weld corner A, Weld corner B). Rationale: Operator B picks up a specific tool required for welding and performs spot welds on two corners. These are direct assembly actions to join parts, so grouped as the core assembly phase.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Group 3: Post-Welding Quality Check (Measure weld integrity). Rationale: After welding, check quality of the welds using a sensor before proceeding further. This is an immediate QC step ensuring that the assembly meets standards.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Group 4: Coating & Curing (Apply protective coating, Dry coating). Rationale: Protective coatings are applied and then dried to ensure proper adherence and finish. These steps prepare the product for final use, involving specific units (Coating Unit #3, Heating Unit #2).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Group 5: Final Inspection (Visual check). Rationale: A visual inspection by Operator C is typically a final quality control step before the product is considered complete.
